article.headline: Boise St. 77, Utah St. 66
article.story: BOISE, Idaho (AP) -- Matt Nelson scored 18 points and had seven rebounds as Boise State defeated Utah State 77-66 Thursday night in the Western Athletic Conference opener for both teams. Reggie Larry added 16 points and six rebounds for the Broncos (7-5, 1-0 WAC). Jaycee Carroll led Utah State (10-4, 0-1 WAC) with 18 points and eight rebounds. Chaz Spicer added 13 points and eight rebounds for the Aggies. The Broncos jumped out to a 20-4 lead by hitting eight of their first 12 shots, including four 3-pointers. Eric Lane opened the game with a 3-pointer and Coby Karl added another, with Tyler Tiedeman hitting back-to-back 3's at the end of the run. But Boise State cooled off, hitting only one more 3-pointer in the half and Utah State started finding the range. The Aggies made a 9-0 run that included a 3-pointer by Nick Hammer, a dunk by Arvydas Vaitiekus, and a layup by Carroll to cut the Broncos' lead to 20-13 with 11:18 left in the half. But the Aggies turned the ball over on three consecutive possessions at the end of the half and went into the break trailing 38-23. Boise State maintained a comfortable lead through the second half despite a dry spell of nearly three minutes. The Aggies cut the lead to 47-33 on back-to-back baskets by Spicer and Carroll. The Broncos responded with a 6-0 run capped by a high-flying dunk by Larry that pushed the lead to 53-33 and brought a roar from the crowd with 9:59 left in the game. The rest of the game degenerated into sloppy play with plenty of fouls, including a technical on Boise State's Seth Robinson with 2:29 remaining. Carroll made both of the foul shots to cut Boise State's lead to 72-58, but the Broncos held on from there.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
